channel.title: Brandon Boswell
channel.description: Recent content from Brandon Boswell's Digital Garden

description.p: 2022-03-20 This was my first time using theChar-Griller Akorn. I set an initial fire in the Akorn to get it to 400 degrees to season the grill grate. This worked well, and I had no issues getting the grill to high temperature, even getting it past 500 degrees. I had a minor challenge where I put the fire out while trying to reduce the temperature significantly to get back to a smoking temperature after running it at high heat. After relighting the fire I cooked the chicken between 225 and 275 for an hour and half until the chicken got to an internal temperature of 145 degrees. At the point, I raised the heat to 325 to crisp up the skin and make it easier to get the chicken to temperature. For this chicken we used a KC BBQ rub along with mayonnaise and olive oil on the underside. Initially I didn’t put enough seasoning on the chicken, but we later added a bit more. The fire was likely 8 to 2 lump to hickory. The chicken was cooked very nicely, but I found the rub to be too sweet for chicken (its probably better suited for pork). I may try something simpler like just salt and pepper next time to see how that compares. For this cook, we were lacking the smoking stone, but were able to substitute in a baking sheet instead for today. The smoking stone will be here tomorrow along with a thermometer that will talk to my phone so that I can monitor the fire from afar.

description.p: One of the best ways to communicate and do Show and Tells inDesign andEngineering. This allows us to do high-quality communication of complex ideas to many people within our team asynchronously. It’s also one of the best ways I’ve found torequest feedback and also to prepare folks for meetings and discussion sessions.

p.a: Vimium is not just for Developers

description.p: Apple /Macbook Pro /MacOS

I think this machine got a bad rap when it came out for only having USB-C ports. I actually think that aspect of the computer is fine and that criticism is a bit harsh. What I can’t look past and I feel make it a dreadful device are:

ul.li: horrible arrow key shape that no longer allows your fingers to find them reliably without looking

description.p: For me the easiest, most likely way to achieveflow state is to throw in theAirPod Pro headphones and set them toNoise Cancellation and turn on one of the following:

I have much higher quality headphones than the Airpods, but some combination of the noise cancellation, weightlessness, and the lack of a cable makes a huge difference in helping me focus on what I need to get done. I do find it odd that I can either listen to calm, quiet music or aggressive dubstep and they both enable the same thing, but they do. I find listening to unfamiliar music with forward lyrics difficult forconcentration. The noise cancellation is also helpful because I find the constant fan noise of theTouchbar Macbook Pro especially annoying.
For listening to music for enjoyment I prefer theHifiman Sundara headphones.Use music without lyrics to help achieve flow state

item.title: I currently prefer two smaller monitors to one ultrawide monitor

description.p: To be completely clear, I have not personally tried an ultrawide monitor, but I would think screensharing and moving windows around would be annoying on one.

item.title: Balancing consuming new content vs reviewing past content
Before we begin creating something new we start by mimicking

description.p: If our brains could remember everything then nothing would be important. Our brains would be an even more calamitous place than it already is. The fact that we forget things we don’t use regularly is actually a feature to make room for the new things you will learn. It is like optimizing forSignal to Noise Ratio

item.title: My Phone is Ruining My Creativity

description.p: Author:Eric Floberg URL:https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ecx8u4inJHM
Therefore, avoiding being bored is the death of creativity.

ul.li: Don’t check your phone for the first hour you wake
Don’t check your phone while moving
Don’t check your phone on the toilet
Don’t check your phone the hour before bed

item.title: The Building a Second Brain Podcast

description.p: Relates toPersonal Knowledge Management
Time Traps I have to watch out for:

ul.li: Feedly - This one at least has an end, but this one can still be 15-20 minute trap
Wordle - At least only one a day and usually is less than 5 minutes

description.p: You especially need to watch out for these duringMy Morning Routine as they will eat up yourMost productive time of the day

item.title: In writing, what the author mean't is irrelevant

description.p: This is an especially challenging trap for me as someone who doesn’t find writing easy. I often find myself in a scenario where someone reads (usually my wife) something I wrote and we discuss it, only for me to find out what I meant and what I wrote were not the same.

hr.p: It is public because in the discussion, it does not matter anymore what the author meant, only what is there in writing.How to Take Smart Notes

description.p: I think my issue with technical requirements is they distract from the engineer thinking about the user and what they are trying to do. This can be helpful in a scenario where the developer has no concept of the user’s needs, but if your engineer has empathy or experience with these people you are coaxing the developer to stop thinking about the user’s needs and to focus on checking these checkboxes. If you’re going to lean heavily on technical requirements remember to enable your engineers to use their empathy.
Author:Simon Sinek URL: Â https://youtu.be/kJdXjtSnZTI

Businesses are good at measuring performance, but bad at measuring trustworthiness. The Navy Seals think of people in a Performance vs Trust matrix. Ideally you want the high performance, high trust individual, but if you can’t have that person you should value high trust over high performing. The high performing, low trust person is toxic to your team. Medium performance individuals can be taught.
